# CaseValue.law

> Free legal case value calculator providing instant settlement estimates for personal injury, employment law, and civil rights cases. Helps injured individuals understand potential compensation before consulting an attorney.

CaseValue.law is an interactive web application that estimates legal case values based on case-specific factors. Users answer questions about their situation and receive instant valuation ranges with explanatory factors.

## Key Features

- **Case Value Calculator**: Interactive questionnaire covering 14 case types
- **Instant Valuations**: Real-time settlement estimates with low/high ranges
- **Educational Blog**: Legal insights on personal injury and employment law
- **Multi-language**: English, Spanish, and Chinese support

## Supported Case Types

- Motor Vehicle Accidents
- Medical Malpractice
- Premises Liability (slip and fall)
- Product Liability
- Wrongful Death
- Dog Bites
- Wrongful Termination
- Wage Disputes
- Class Action
- Insurance Bad Faith
- Disability Discrimination
- Professional Negligence
- Civil Rights Violations
- Intellectual Property

## Main Pages

- [Calculator](https://casevalue.law/): Main case value calculator application
- [Blog](https://casevalue.law/blog): Legal news and educational articles

## Documentation

- [Sitemap](https://casevalue.law/sitemap.xml): Complete list of all pages
- [Privacy Policy](https://casevalue.law/): Available via modal on site
- [Terms of Service](https://casevalue.law/): Available via modal on site

## Optional

- [Blog: How Accident Date Affects Settlement](https://casevalue.law/blog/how-accident-date-affects-auto-settlement): Statute of limitations impact
- [Blog: MMI and Settlement Delays](https://casevalue.law/blog/mmi-insurance-adjuster-settlement-delays-2025): Maximum medical improvement explained
- [Blog: Lost Wages Documentation](https://casevalue.law/blog/lost-wages-101-documenting-missed-work-settlement): How to document income loss
- [Blog: Treatment Gaps](https://casevalue.law/blog/gap-in-treatment-lowers-case-value): Why continuous treatment matters
